licensing: Do not copy proprietary text; author original summaries.
privacy: Do not include secrets or personal data in escalation resolutions.
safety: Do not overwrite existing escalation resolution records.
Reject context and escalation_id values containing path separators or dot-segments.

acceptance_criteria: Creates an escalation resolution record under runtime/contexts/<context>/escalations/.
Fails when the referenced escalation record is missing.
Logs a U.Work record when telemetry/log-work is available.

failure_modes: Invalid context or escalation_id value (not a safe path segment).
Escalation record missing for the provided escalation_id.
Failed to write the escalation resolution record.

inputs.description: Bounded context name used to locate runtime/contexts/<context> (must be a safe path segment).
inputs.name: context

inputs.description: Escalation identifier to resolve (safe path segment; may include dots).
inputs.name: escalation_id

inputs.description: Optional RoleAssignment label used when logging U.Work (default: Strategist).
inputs.name: role_assignment

inputs.description: Optional semicolon-delimited list of related DRR ids or paths.
inputs.name: decisions

inputs.description: Optional ISO-8601 timestamp_start override (used for deterministic testing).
inputs.name: timestamp_start

intent.goal: Record the resolution of an escalation request.
non_goals: Does not modify the original escalation record.

name: Resolve Escalation

outputs.description: Path to the generated escalation resolution markdown file.
outputs.name: resolution_record_path

procedure.instruction: Validate required inputs (context, escalation_id, decision) and ensure safe path segments.
Locate the referenced escalation record and confirm it exists.
Write the escalation resolution record with the decision and notes.
If telemetry/log-work is available, log the escalation resolution with agent metadata when provided.

summary: Records a resolution for a human escalation.
